monogr.title: Contra tenor, of Songes, for three, fower, and fiue voyces, composed and made by Thomas Whythorne gent. the which songes be of sundry sortes, that is to say, some long, some short, some hard, some easie to be songe, and some betwene both: also some solemne, and some pleasant or mery: so that according to the skill of the singers (not being musitians) and disposition or delite of the hearers, they may here finde songes for their contentation and liking. Now newly published. An. 1571. In the tenor or fift booke, ye shall haue the preface of the author, wherein he declareth more at large the contentes of these his fiue bookes
monogr.author: Whythorne, Thomas

div.head: ¶In Musicen Tho. Whithorni Hexasticon ad Lectorem.
div.l: CAndide sume tibi, lector, praeludia musae,
hoc{que} lubēs spectes, quod modò surgit opus.
vt merita meritum laude fruatur opus.
Nec multū curat, probat, improbat aemula turba,
ipse bonis manult, quàm placuisse malis.

div.head: Eiusdem carmen Phaleucium siue Endecasyllabum.
div.l: Perpende has pretio, has ames, emas{que}:
